Title: After Freud: Sophocles' Oedipus in the Twenty-First Century
Source: Tradit., Transl., Trauma: The Class. and the Mod.
Abstract: © Oxford University Press 2011. All rights reserved.This chapter explores how Sophocles' Oedipus the King can be viewed in light of changes in sexual and familial relations in the twenty-first century. It argues that Oedipus continues to speak to issues of contemporary identity, just as it did for Freud. The play, like Freud's own theories, becomes like a buried source or origin, but one whose meanings change all the time, in each generation as it is unearthed and reinterpreted in the light of our new day - so like and so unlike the old days.
